data.label: Operational excellence
data.shortDescription: Efficiently deploy, operate, monitor, and manage your cloud workloads.

data.label: Security, privacy, and compliance
data.shortDescription: Maximize the security of your data and workloads in the cloud, design for privacy, and align with regulatory requirements and standards.

data.label: Reliability
data.shortDescription: Design and operate resilient and highly available workloads in the cloud.

data.label: System Design
data.shortDescription: Best Practices and Recommendations to define the architecture, components, modules, interfaces, and data needed to satisfy cloud system requirements,

data.label: Cost Optimization
data.shortDescription: Maximize the business value of your investment in Google Cloud.

data.label: Performance Optimization
data.shortDescription: Design and tune your cloud resources for optimal performance.

data.label: Documentation
data.shortDescription: Fosters communication, guides design decisions, and aids in onboarding new team members. Change logs track evolution and aid performance measurement.

data.label: Keep it simple stupid
data.shortDescription: Simplicity is crucial in system design. Use managed services, start with a minimal viable product, and iterate for improvements.

data.label: Decouple
data.shortDescription: Decoupling separates applications into smaller components, enabling independent operation. Benefits include flexibility in upgrades, security, reliability, monitoring, performance, and cost control.

data.label: Go Stateless
data.shortDescription: Stateless architecture enhances application reliability and scalability. Stateful applications rely on dependencies, while stateless apps use shared storage and cached services for increased scalability, resilience, and performance.

data.label: Fault Tolerance/Resiliency/DR
data.shortDescription: Ensure fault-tolerance, resiliency, disaster recovery by deploying to multi regions or zones.

data.label: Compliance/Regulations
data.shortDescription: Constraint use to certain regions to meet geographic regulatory or compliance regulations (e.g. GDPR)

data.label: Service availability
data.shortDescription: Although most services are available for all regions, some enterprise-specific services might be available in a subset of regions

data.label: Tags and Labels
data.shortDescription: Use tags and labels (early) for access control, monitoring and billing

data.label: Resource Hierachies
data.shortDescription: Google Cloud resources are arranged hierarchically in organizations, folders, and projects. This hierarchy lets you manage common aspects of your resources like access control, configuration settings, and policies

data.label: Automate
data.shortDescription: Automate the creation of resources

data.label: Enforce
data.shortDescription: Enforce standardized policies, name conventions, billing policies, compliance requirements across you gcp resources

data.label: Restrict
data.shortDescription:
Restrict use of services, specific regions 
 or actions (e.g creation of service account keys, sharing of resources) with org. policies

data.label: Chose
data.shortDescription: Serverless (Cloud Run, Cloud Functions, ..), Kubernetes or VM (Compute Engine) based on your workload and migration approach (lift-shift, rip-replace etc.)

data.label: Workload VPC architecture
data.shortDescription:
Identify decision makers, timelines, and pre-work.Consider VPC network design early.
Keep it simple. Use clear naming conventions.

data.label: Sustainablity
data.shortDescription: Use regions based on minimal carbon footprint

data.label: Latency
data.shortDescription: To reduce latency, choose regions close to your users

data.label: Cloud SQL
data.shortDescription: managed database service on Google Cloud, offering performance, scalability, and administration for PostgreSQL, MySQL, and SQL Server.

data.label: BigTable
data.shortDescription: highly scalable NoSQL database for storing massive amounts of single-keyed data with low latency

data.label: Spanner
data.shortDescription: Scalable, globally distributed database with high-performance transactions, consistency, and enterprise-grade security.

data.label: Memorystore
data.shortDescription: fully managed Redis service

data.label: Firestore
data.shortDescription: NoSQL document database built for automatic scaling, high performance, and application development

data.label: AlloyDB
data.shortDescription: ully managed PostgreSQL-compatible database service for demanding enterprise workloads

data.label: Open Source Databases
data.shortDescription: Google partners offer different open source databases, including MongoDB, MariaDB, and Redis.

data.label: Scale
data.shortDescription: Scale easily by using managed services (Cloud Run, or GKE Autoscaler, etc), automation or startup/shutdown scripts for VMs and Managed Instance Groups

data.label: Network Infrastrucutre
data.shortDescription: optimize for performance and secure application communications with internal and external services

data.label: manage
data.shortDescription: Set storage life cycle rules, assign unique & randomized names, keep buckets private

data.label: Cloud Storage
data.shortDescription: store data at scale at the lowest cost, and access performance is not an issue.

data.label: Persistent Disk/SSD
data.shortDescription: compute applications that need immediate storage.

data.label: Filestore
data.shortDescription: high-performance workloads that need read and write access to shared space.

data.label: BigQuery
data.shortDescription: Serverless, scalable Data Warehouse of Terra- or Petabytes of data

data.label: PubSub
data.shortDescription: Scalable messaging service for asynchronous communication, enabling decoupled and reliable data exchange.

data.label: DataFlow
data.shortDescription: fully managed, serverless data processing service for building and executing data pipelines

data.label: Dataprep
data.shortDescription: Intelligent data service to visually explore, clean, and prepare structured and unstructured data for analysis.

data.label: Dataproc
data.shortDescription: Fast, easy-to-use, and fully managed cloud service to run Apache Spark and Apache Hadoop clusters.

data.label: BigQuery
data.shortDescription: analyze terabytes to petabytes of data.

data.label: Datafusion
data.shortDescription: fully managed,graphical data integration service for building and managing data pipelines
